conclusion: To solve this problem, we need to understand the flow of liquid through the baffles and determine which container (D or E) the liquid will flow into.
The liquid sources are labeled A, B, and C.
The baffles are the vertical structures that guide the flow of the liquid.
The liquid from A flows down and is guided by the baffle to the right.
The liquid from B flows down and is guided by the baffle to the right.
The liquid from C flows down and is guided by the baffle to the right.

premise: The liquid from A flows down and is guided by the baffle to the right. The liquid from B flows down and is guided by the baffle to the right.
conclusion: The liquid from A and B is directed to the right and flows into container D.

premise: The liquid from C flows down and is guided by the baffle to the right.
conclusion: The liquid from C is directed to the right and flows into container E.

premise: The liquid from A and B will flow into container D. The liquid from C will flow into container E.
conclusion: Liquid from A and B will flow into container D. Liquid from C will flow into container E.
